content:
The fundamental insight is practical and not in any way mystical or ethereal. 

What Eckart Tolle and myself are trying to communicate is an insight into the way that thought and beliefs operate in your own mind that cause a minor but sudden change in how your brain physiologically operates. It results in instantly seeing "oh, I don't need beliefs to act". And that causes emotional and perceptual change. 

Ramana speaks on the same subject, but he is in some way "the mystic's mystic" in that he he speaks like every word is going to be poetry or biblical, but he is fundamentally just trying to say the same thing, which is the cessation of emotional relationship to self-imagination.
